user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters.
This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in <string.h> such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_ip_addr_to_key:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
MHD_ip_addr_to_key (const struct sockaddr_storage *addr,
                    socklen_t addrlen,
                    struct MHD_IPCount *key)
{
  memset (key,
          0,
          sizeof(*key));

  /* IPv4 addresses */
  if (sizeof (struct sockaddr_in) <= (size_t) addrlen)
  {
    if (AF_INET == addr->ss_family)
    {
      key->family = AF_INET;
      memcpy (&key->addr.ipv4,
              &((const struct sockaddr_in *) addr)->sin_addr,
              sizeof(((const struct sockaddr_in *) NULL)->sin_addr));
      return MHD_YES;
    }
  }

#ifdef HAVE_INET6
  if (sizeof (struct sockaddr_in6) <= (size_t) addrlen)
  {
    /* IPv6 addresses */
    if (AF_INET6 == addr->ss_family)
    {
      key->family = AF_INET6;
      memcpy (&key->addr.ipv6,
              &((const struct sockaddr_in6 *) addr)->sin6_addr,
              sizeof(((const struct sockaddr_in6 *) NULL)->sin6_addr));
      return MHD_YES;
    }
  }
#endif

  /* Some other address */
  return MHD_NO;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (AF_INET6 == addr->ss_family)
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 21.17 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the fragment performs an integer comparison of addr->ss_family to AF_INET6 and does not call any functions from <string.h>. Rule 21.17 concerns uses of string handling functions that can access out-of-bounds memory; this expression cannot trigger that rule. (Unrelated note: dereferencing addr->ss_family requires addr to be non-NULL and addrlen sufficient for the sockaddr_storage layout, but that is outside Rule 21.17.)
